p: Cyclophosphamide is an oxazaphosphorine substituted nitrogen mustard, with strong cytotoxic and immunosuppressive activity. 6 It is the mainstay of most preparative regimens for organ-transplant and broadly active anticancer agent used in combination chemotherapy for Hodgkin’s disease, non–Hodgkin’s lymphoma, leukaemia, rheumatoid arthritis, Burkitt’s lymphoma, lupus erythematosus, multiple sclerosis, neuroblastoma, multiple myeloma, endometrial cancer, breast cancer and lung cancer. 7
